channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Britain's Wild Places
channel.desc: An intimate portrait of one of Britain's most charming wild animals, following a family of water voles living on a canal in Derbyshire though a typical year.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: All Creatures Great and Small
channel.desc: While James is concerned about possible professional incompetence, Tristan tries to convince Mr Hartley of the virtues of artificial insemination.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: All Creatures Great and Small
channel.desc: Smallholder Lionel Brough has a motley collection of stock, but when an inheritance allows him to go in for pig keeping in a big way, James diagnoses a case of swine fever.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Families Like Ours
channel.desc: Danes hold a farewell service. Laura is devastated her mother is not joining her in Paris. Contains very strong language and some violent scenes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Families Like Ours
channel.desc: Fanny and Laura do their best to put on a brave face as Fanny departs for Romania. Contains some strong language.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Abi Morgan
channel.desc: Screenwriter and playwright Abi Morgan talks to John Wilson about her creative influences.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Good Life
channel.desc: Seventies sitcom about a couple who decide to become self-sufficient. Margo is horrified when she hears of Tom and Barbara's decision to keep pigs in the garden.

channel.title: Yes Minister
channel.desc: First episode of the acclaimed sitcom about an apparently clueless British government minister and the advisers who surround him.

channel.title: Elaine Paige
channel.desc: A celebration of Elaine Paige's 60-year career in show business.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Elaine Paige Remembers... A Night on the Town
channel.desc: Elaine Paige looks back on A Night on the Town - a musical extravaganza from the early 1980s, filmed with a mostly American cast of singers and dancers.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: A Night on the Town
channel.desc: Musical spectacular, first broadcast in 1983, showcasing the work of Irving Berlin, Noel Coward, George Gershwin and Cole Porter. Ann Reinking and Lewis Collins are transported back in time.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Elaine Paige at the BBC
channel.desc: A selection of some of Elaine Paige's best-loved songs and finest performances at the BBC, including huge hits like Don't Cry for Me Argentina, Memory and I Know Him So Well.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Elaine Paige
channel.desc: A special concert filmed at London's prestigious Royal Albert Hall, featuring 'the first lady of British musical theatre' with the 60-piece BBC Concert Orchestra.

channel.title: Great British Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Michael Portillo strikes out on another series of railway journeys, starting with a tour of the Home Counties and beyond in the city of dreaming spires, Oxford.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Wainwright Walks
channel.desc: Julia Bradbury explores the work of fell walker Alfred Wainwright. She faces Scafell Pike, England's highest peak, and must reach the 978m summit before darkness falls.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Art of World War II - A Culture Show Special
channel.desc: Alastair Sooke explores the often overlooked history of Britain's wartime renaissance. Contains some scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: World War II
channel.desc: Saul David uses the BBC archive to examine the most important stories related to World War II, and how our understanding of them has been redefined since the war ended.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Sky at Night
channel.desc: The Sky at Night team explore what the latest research is revealing about Mars. Could life once have thrived there? And will a return trip to our neighbouring planet ever be possible.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Andrew Roberts Remembers... AJP Taylor's The War Lords
channel.desc: Historian Andrew Roberts looks back AJP Taylor's 1976 series The War Lords, in which he examines the lives and motives of the key leaders in the Second World War.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The War Lords
channel.desc: AJP Taylor describes the careers of the 'war lords' who dominated the Second World War. This episode looks at Mussolini.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The War Lords
channel.desc: AJP Taylor describes the careers of the 'war lords' who dominated the Second World War. This episode looks at Hitler.

channel.title: The Good Life
channel.desc: Sitcom. To practice self-sufficiency successfully, every resource must be utilised - even animal dung - so Tom decides to build a generator.

channel.title: Yes Minister
channel.desc: Political sitcom. When Hacker recognises a visiting head of an African nation as a school friend, he does his best to offload some oil rigging gear on him. Contains adult humour.

channel.title: Simon Schama Remembers... The Power of Art
channel.desc: Simon Schama looks back on his 2006 series examining the works of eight artists.

channel.title: Simon Schama's Power of Art
channel.desc: Simon Schama recounts the story of eight moments of high drama in the making of eight masterpieces. How Caravaggio changed the way artists portrayed religious icons.

channel.title: Atlantic
channel.desc: Documentary on the Atlantic Ocean. In the South Atlantic, chains of extraordinary islands are packed with huge pods of dolphins and massive penguin colonies.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Shipwrecks
channel.desc: Dr Sam Willis takes the story of shipwrecks into the Georgian age when Britain began to rule the waves and disasters at sea imperilled its trading power.

channel.desc: A patient struggles to keep his sanity while his alter ego, a private eye, keeps singing. Deals with adult themes.

channel.title: Colm Toibin
channel.desc: Alan Yentob talks to acclaimed and curiously divided Irish writer Colm Toibin. Loud and affable in person, Toibin writes sombre stories of grief and quiet heartbreak.
